title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 358-5.8 - Media admission to fair hearing
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 §§ 358-5.8 - Media admission to fair hearing

State Regulations
(a) The media may be admitted to a fair
hearing where the appellant has made a specific waiver of appellant's right to
confidentiality both in writing and on the record and has clearly and
unequivocally confirmed on the record that the appellant desires and consents
to the presence of the media. The waiver must be unqualified, complete, and
made with full knowledge of the ramifications of the waiver, including that the
waiver is irrevocable. (b) Where a
waiver has been secured in accordance with subdivision (a) of this section, the
extent of any access to be granted to the media is to be determined at the
discretion of the hearing officer. In determining the extent of such access, the hearing officer will consider the following: (1)
maintenance of proper hearing
decorum; (2)
potential disruption
to the proceedings; (3)
adverse
effect on witnesses; (4)
impediments to the making of a proper and accurate record; (5)
the physical space and conditions of the
hearing room; (6)
potential
disruption to the hearing officer, including impediments to the hearing
officer's ability to discharge responsibilities; and
(7)
any other factor which, in the discretion
of the hearing officer, is necessary to ensure the orderly and proper conduct
of the hearing and the creation of a complete and accurate hearing record or
which is necessary in order to protect confidential information where
confidentiality cannot be waived by the appellant. Notes
